Screen and separate size fractions

Small fastener kit for electronics, instrumentation, and light mechanical assemblies.

recipe_def.name: Recipe for valve body cast rough v1

steps.notes: Hot forge hex heads on bolt blanks and upset nut blanks using dies
Cut external threads on bolts (M6-M12) and tap internal threads in nuts using lathes and tapping machines
Stamp flat washers and lock washers from steel sheet stock using progressive dies
Heat treat bolts and lock washers for hardness and spring properties (austenitizing, quenching, tempering)
Inspect heat-treated fasteners for hardness and dimensional checks
Sort fasteners by size (M6, M8, M10, M12), count, and kit into organized container

recipe_def.assumptions:
Complete fastener manufacturing from steel stock to finished kit. Process integrates:
- Hot forging for head formation (hex heads on bolts, upset blanks for nuts)
- Thread cutting via single-point turning (bolts) and tapping (nuts)
- Sheet metal stamping for washer production
- Heat treatment for strength and hardness
- Final inspection and kitting

Input materials: 2.0 kg steel stock (1.0 kg bar/billet, 1.0 kg sheet)
Output: 1.0 kg complete fastener kit per BOM specification
Scrap rate: ~50% from machining chips and stamping waste (conservative placeholder)
recipe_def.notes:
Six-step recipe for fastener_kit_medium production.

Kit composition per bom_fastener_kit_medium_v0:
- 720g hex bolts M6-M12 in various lengths (76 pieces total)
- 180g hex nuts M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 75g flat washers M6-M12 (135 pieces total)
- 30g lock washers M6-M12 (60 pieces total)
Total: ~366 fasteners, 1.0 kg net weight

Manufacturing process details:
1. Forging: Form hex heads on bolt blanks, upset nut blanks for adequate thread engagement
2. Threading: Cut external threads on bolts (dies or single-point), tap nuts (spiral point taps)
3. Washer stamping: Progressive die stamps flat and lock washers from sheet
4. Heat treatment: Quench and temper bolts to grade 8.8 equivalent, harden lock washers
5. Inspection: Verify hardness and dimensional checks
6. Kitting: Sort by size, verify counts, package in compartmented container

Total time: ~8 hours (primarily sequential, some parallel opportunity for washers)
References detailed specification in design/memos/fastener_kit_specification.md
Most commonly used fastener kit in the KB (107 BOMs reference this item)

recipe_def.assumptions: Rotary vane or diaphragm vacuum pump for moderate vacuum levels. Critical for thermionic vacuum tube assembly and leak testing operations.
recipe_def.notes: Small vacuum pump assembly. Used for vacuum tube fabrication in thermionic systems and general vacuum applications. Total assembly time ~13 hours.

steps.notes: Assemble frame and mount compressor/vacuum pump, install pressure gauges and leak detection sensors with control panel, connect pneumatic lines with regulators and valves, calibrate pressure gauges and sensors, test system integrity and leak detection, verify all connections

recipe_def.assumptions: Leak test equipment with air compressor, vacuum pump, pressure gauges, and leak detection sensors - 60 kg system for testing tanks, vessels, and sealed systems
recipe_def.notes: Assembly of leak test equipment essential for verifying hermetic seals in thermionic converters and testing pressure vessels
